question: Martin, a hacker, aimed to crash a target system. For this purpose, he spoofed the source IP address with the target's IP address and sent many ICMP ECHO request packets to an IP broadcast network, causing all the hosts to respond to the received ICMP ECHO requests and ultimately crashing the target machine. Identify the type of attack performed by Martin in the above scenario.

Williams, a professional hacker, was hired by an organization to damage the reputation of their rival company. Williams spoofed a customer's rival company's IP address and initiated sending multiple ICMP ECHO request packets to an IP broadcast network. As a result, all the hosts together started sending responses to the customer's IP address. These responses were sent to the customer machine, diverting significant traffic toward it and crashing it in the process. Identify the type of attack performed by Williams in the above scenario.

Kevin, an attacker, is attempting to compromise a cloud server. In this process, Kevin intercepted the SOAP messages transmitted between a user and the server, manipulated the body of the message, and then redirected it to the server as a legitimate user to gain access and run malicious code on the cloud server. Identify the attack initiated by Kevin on the target cloud server.

Roxanne is a professional hacker hired by an agency to disrupt the business services of their rival company. Roxanne employed a special type of malware that consumes a server's memory and network bandwidth when triggered. Consequently, the target server is overloaded and stops responding. Identify the type of malware Roxanne has used in the above scenario.

Melissa, an ex-employee of an organization, was fired because of misuse of resources and security violations. She sought revenge against the company and targeted its network, as she is already aware of its network topology. Which of the following categories of insiders does Melissa belong to?
Which of the following practices makes web applications vulnerable to SQL injection attacks?
options: Use the most restrictive SQL account types for applications
Never build Transact SQL statements directly from user input
Avoid constructing dynamic SQL with concatenated input values
A Accept entries that contain binary data, escape sequences, and comment characters
answer: A Accept entries that contain binary data, escape sequences, and comment characters

question: Melanie, a professional hacker, is attempting to break into a target network through an application server. In this process, she identified a logic flaw in the target web application that provided visibility into the source code. She exploited this vulnerability to launch further attacks on the target web application. Which of the web application vulnerabilities was identified by Melanie in the above scenario?

Johnson is a professional hacker who targeted an organization’s customers and decided to crack their system passwords. In this process, he found a list of valid customers, created a list of possible passwords, ranked the passwords from high to low probability, and started keying in each password in the target system until the correct password is discovered. Identify the type of attack performed by Johnson in the above scenario.

William is an attacker who is attempting to hack Bluetooth-enabled devices at public places. Within the target’s range, he used special software to obtain the data stored in the victim’s device. He used a technique that exploits the vulnerability in the OBject Exchange (OBEX) protocol that Bluetooth uses to exchange information. Identify the attack performed by William in the above scenario.
In which of the following levels of the OSI model does an attacker gain control over the HTTP user session by obtaining the session IDs and create new unauthorized sessions by using the stolen data?

Christian is working as a software developer in a reputed MNC. He received a message from XIM bank that claims to be urgent and requests to call a phone number mentioned in the message. Worried by this, he called the number to check on his account, believing it to be an authentic XIM Bank customer service phone number. A recorded message asks him to provide his credit or debit card number, as well as his password. Identify the type of social engineering attack being performed on Christian in the above scenario.

James is a professional hacker who managed to penetrate the target company’s network and tamper with software by adding a malicious script in the production that holds persistence on the network. Which of the following phases of hacking is James currently in?

Paola, a professional hacker, configured her wireless router in an organization's premises and advertised it with a spoofed SSID. She lured victims to connect to the router by sending the fake SSID. She started sniffing all the traffic from the victims that is passing through his wireless router. Which of the following types of attacks is Paola performing in the above scenario?

Clark is an unskilled hacker attempting to perform an attack on a target organization to gain popularity. He downloaded and used freely available hacking tools and software developed by other professional hackers for this purpose. Identify the type of threat actor described in the above scenario.

Which of the following cloud computing threats arises from authentication vulnerabilities, user-provisioning and de-provisioning vulnerabilities, hypervisor vulnerabilities, unclear roles and responsibilities, and misconfigurations?

Michael is an attacker who aims to hack Bob's system. He started collecting data without any active interaction with Bob's system. Using this technique. Michael can extract sensitive information from unencrypted data. Identify the class of attack Michael has launched in the above scenario.

James, a malware programmer, intruded into a manufacturing plant that produces computer peripheral devices. James tampered with the software inside devices ready to be delivered to clients. The tampered program creates a backdoor that allows unauthorized access to the systems. Identify the type of attack performed by James in the above scenario to gain unauthorized access to the delivered systems.
Given below are the various phases of hacking. 1. Reconnaissance 2. Gaining access 3. Maintaining access 4. Clearing tracks 5. Scanning What is the correct sequence of phases involved in hacking?

Given below are various stages involved in the virus lifecycle. 1. Replication 2. Incorporation 3. Launch 4. Execution of the damage routine 5. Design 6. Detection Identify the correct sequence of stages involved in the virus lifecycle.

John, a professional hacker, targeted an employee of an organization to intrude and gain access to the corporate network. He employed a sniffer to capture packets and authentication tokens between the employee and the organization's server. After extracting relevant information, he transmitted the captured tokens back to the server to gain access as a legitimate user. Identify the type of attack performed by John in the above scenario.
Which of the following practices can make devices or networks vulnerable to password cracking attempts?
options: A. using different passwords that the time of password change
B. not using a random string (salt) as a password prefix or suffix before performing encryption
C. changing the system's default passwords
D. using passwords that are not available in the dictionary
answer: B. not using a random string (salt) as a password prefix or suffix before performing encryption

question: In which of the following types of identity theft does the perpetrator obtain information from different victims to create a new identity by stealing a social security number and use it with a combination of fake names, dates of birth, addresses, and other details required for creating a new identity?

Which of the following protocols is used to communicate through port 23 and allows an attacker to log in to a network machine remotely via a TCP connection to sniff keystrokes, including usernames and passwords, that are sent in cleartext?
Which of the following countermeasures helps security teams defend against sniffing attacks?
options: A. use a hub instead of a switch
C. use static IP addresses and ARP tables
D. retrieve MAC addresses directly from OS instead of the NICs
answer: C. use static IP addresses and ARP tables

question: In which of the following session hijacking phases does an attacker must change the sequence number or acknowledgment number (SEQ/ACK) of the server?
Ellie, an 18-year-old student, encrypts her drive with inbuilt Windows software so that her mischievous brother cannot access her assignments. Which software did Ellie use?
An attacker initiates a sniffing attack and gets sensitive data while in transition. What element of Information Security was affected?
Tampering with a server prior to installation is an example of what type of attack?
An attacker intercepted and monitored network traffic without tampering with the data. What type of attack is this?
The 'Electronic Transactions and Code Set Standards' are related to which civil act?
Which phase of the Cyber Kill Chain methodology includes creating a deliverable payload?
What type of hackers aims to bring down critical infrastructure for a 'cause' and isn't worried about facing jail terms or any other punishment?
What is the term for an attacker who aims to gain popularity and uses existing tools to perform an attack?
What is the correct order of the hacking phases?
options: Reconnaissance, scanning, gaining access, maintaining access, clearing tracks
Scanning, reconnaissance, gaining access, maintaining access, clearing tracks
Gaining access, reconnaissance, scanning, maintaining access, clearing tracks
Maintaining access, gaining access, reconnaissance, scanning, clearing tracks
answer: Reconnaissance, scanning, gaining access, maintaining access, clearing tracks

question: Using scripts to maintain persistence on a web server refers to which phase of the hacking phases?
An unskilled administrator who did not attend training claims to be an expert and makes configuration mistakes which lead to an attack. This is an example of what type of threat?
A shopping enthusiast receives an email to download a new shopping app, which leads to her data being accessed by an attacker. What is this an example of?
Which component of a malware protects it from undergoing reverse engineering or analysis?
What type of malware is activated when a user performs certain predefined actions?
What type of Trojan can destroy or change the entire content of a database or physically change the underlying HTML format of websites?
What is the sole purpose of a destructive Trojan?
What are the stages of a virus lifecycle?
options: Design, replication, launch, detection, incorporation, execution of the damage routine
Replication, launch, detection, incorporation, execution of the damage routine
Design, launch, replication, detection, incorporation, execution of the damage routine
answer: Design, replication, launch, detection, incorporation, execution of the damage routine

question: What type of malware consumes network bandwidth, system memory, etc., excessively overloading servers and computer systems?
What type of password cracking attack involves creating a list of possible passwords, ranking them from high to low probability, and then entering each password until the correct one is discovered?
A Rainbow Table Attack is an example of which type of password cracking attack?
Which of the following is a password cracking tool?
What is a good countermeasure for password cracking?
options: Use passwords that can be found in a dictionary
Do not use passwords that can be found in a dictionary
Use a single password for all accounts
answer: Do not use passwords that can be found in a dictionary

question: What is the term for the unauthorized listening to conversations or reading of messages, intercepting audio, video, or written communication?
An attacker requests an authorized person to unlock a security door, saying they have forgotten their ID badge. What is this an example of?

Tracy, a software engineer, receives an SMS from what appears to be her bank. It asks her to call a listed number immediately. She calls, and a recorded message asks for her credit card number and password, which she provides. What is this attack called?
What is the term for a disgruntled or terminated employee who steals data or intentionally destroys a company's network by introducing malware?

What type of identity theft occurs when an attacker steals a Social Security Number and uses it with a combination of fake names, dates of birth, addresses, and other details to create a new identity?
What type of attack makes a switch broadcast traffic to all connected devices?
What is the process of inundating DHCP servers with fake DHCP requests, using all the available IP addresses?
Which of the following is a sniffing countermeasure?
options: Use static IP addresses and ARP tables
answer: Use static IP addresses and ARP tables

question: Which sniffer detection technique involves sending a non-broadcast ARP to all the nodes in the network?

What type of DDoS attack involves an attacker spoofing the source IP address with the victim's IP address and sending a large number of ICMP ECHO request packets to an IP broadcast network, causing all hosts to respond to the victim machine?
What type of DDoS attack occurs when an attacker sends fraudulent content via email, IRC chats, tweets, or posts, which then gives the attacker access to the victim's computer?

What attack is also known as a brute-force attack, where an attacker makes several attempts to connect with varying session IDs until the actual session ID is determined, due to the absence of account lockout for invalid session IDs?
During which phase of session hijacking must the attacker change the sequence number or acknowledgment number (SEQ/ACK) of the server?
Which component of a web server provides storage on a different machine or disk after the original disk becomes full and can be used to provide object-level security?
Using HTTP to perform an attack relates to the security of which layer of the OSI model?
An attacker couldn't get access to internal resources due to a firewall, so he exploited a vulnerability in the web server to get to the internal resources. What type of attack did he perform?
A misconfiguration in the business flow relates to which layer of the web application architecture?
Which of the following web application vulnerabilities allows untrusted data to be interpreted and executed as part of a command or query?
An attack case about sessions and their IDs relates to which type of vulnerability?
What type of SQL injection involves an attacker injecting an additional malicious query into the original query?
Which of the following is a countermeasure for SQL injection attacks?
options: Allow all data types in entries
Reject entries that contain binary data, escape sequences, and comment characters
answer: Reject entries that contain binary data, escape sequences, and comment characters

question: What type of attack involves an attacker intercepting messages and resending them back to the server?
A network administrator needs to connect 600 new laptops to a wireless network where the company has a single broadband router. What type of wireless network should he go for?
Which IEEE 802 standard is related to WiMAX?
What are the encryption algorithms used in WPA2?
What type of wireless attack involves setting up an AP on a company's premises with a spoofed SSID?
Which type of wireless attack overwhelms the network with traffic?
What type of Bluetooth attacks exploits a vulnerability in the Object Exchange (OBEX) protocol?
What is the type of Bluetooth attack in which an attacker gains remote access to a target Bluetooth-enabled device and then uses that access for further attacks?
Which of the following mobile threats/attacks helps attackers gain access and retrieve sensitive data?
What category of mobile threat/attack refers to binary patching, local resource modification, method hooking, method swizzling, and dynamic memory modification?
What is the name of an attack that is carried out by persuading the victim to install a malicious app designed and published by an attacker?
An employee working remotely used her laptop in a cafe to check her work email using the cafe's network. What risk is related to this scenario?
Which of the following is a general guideline for mobile platform security?
Which IoT architecture layer is responsible for the sensors and hardware?
Which IoT architecture layer is responsible for the delivery of services to the relevant users from different sectors?
IoT security problems such as insecure API, lack of communication channels encryption, authentication, and lack of storage security relate to which layer?

Which one of the IoT attacks refers to attackers intercepting legitimate messages from valid communication and continuously sending the intercepted message to the target device to perform a denial-of-service attack?
What type of attack involves attackers tampering with the operating conditions, modifying the level of the power supply, and/or altering the clock frequency of the chip?
Which of the following is an IoT attack countermeasure?
What technique is used to isolate networks and assets to impose and maintain strong access control mechanisms?
What type of attack involves attackers retrieving critical information from an OT system by observing its physical implementation using techniques like timing analysis and power analysis?
What attack involves attackers hijacking the original remote controller and pairing it with the machine using a malicious RF controller disguised as a legitimate one?
Which cloud service model offers development tools, configuration management, and deployment platforms on-demand that can be used by subscribers to develop custom applications?
What type of cloud deployment model allows an organization to retain full control over its corporate data?
According to the NIST framework, which cloud entity manages cloud services in terms of use, performance, and delivery, and maintains the relationship between cloud providers and consumers?
Which tier of container technology is responsible for storing images and disseminating images to the orchestrators based on requests?
What is the term for a type of cloud attack where one cloud customer can access the data or resources of another customer, often due to misconfiguration of the cloud environment?
What type of attack is performed during the translation of the SOAP message in the TLS layer, where attackers duplicate the body of the message and send it to the server as a legitimate user?
A user receives a fitness report that looks unusual and is asked for credentials. What type of attack is this, related to cloud storage?
If the goal of a penetration test is defined before it begins as risk assessment, what type of penetration test is it?
What type of penetration test assesses against the compliance requirements of cybersecurity standards, frameworks, laws, and acts?
What type of penetration test mimics the behavior of a real attacker to evaluate the overall security of an organization?

Don, a professional hacker, targeted an organization and decided to disrupt its online services. Don initiated an attack by injecting a malicious query into the original query Which of the following types attack has Don performed in the above scenario?
Which of the following practices can make an application or database server vulnerable to SQL injection attacks?
options: A. test the content of string variables and accept only expected values
B. keep untrusted data separate from commands and queries
C. allow entries that contain binary data, escape sequences, and comment characters
D. apply least privilege rules to run the applications that access the DBMS
answer: C. allow entries that contain binary data, escape sequences, and comment characters

question: Which of the following defines the standards for a WiMax and designed to provide multiple physical layer (PHY) and MAC options?

Which of the following types of attack involves replacing legitimate apps in a mobile device with malicious apps designed by a hacker and producing a large volume of advertisements on the target device to attain financial benefits?

Alana, an employee in an organization, took a short break after spending exhausting hours on a project. For relaxation, she went to a cafeteria with her laptop, where she connected to the public Internet. While browsing the web, she received a project modifications file on her mail and reverted with another file that contained the required changes. Which of the following BYOD risk was demonstrated in the above scenario?
options: C. sharing confidential data on unsecured networks
answer: C. sharing confidential data on unsecured networks

question: Joseph, a professional hacker, targeted an employee of an organization to intrude and gain access to the network. He initiated the attack using sniffers to capture packets and authentication tokens between the employee and the server he was communicating with. After intercepting the messages, he started continuously sending the intercepted messages to the server. Identify the type of attack performed by Joseph in the above scenario.
Which of the following countermeasures helps security professionals in securing an IoT device from malicious activity?
options: A. enable UPnP port on routers
B. disable monitor traffic on port 48101

question: Identify the attack in which attackers use timing analysis and power analysis techniques to retrieve critical information from an OT system.

Jane, a third-party security auditor, received an email from one of his client organizations seeking advice on securing corporate data on the cloud environment. Jane suggested a cloud deployment model that provides full control over corporate data and can be managed within the organization. Which of the following cloud deployment models has Jane suggested to the organization?
Identify the NIST cloud deployment reference architecture entity that manages cloud services regarding use, performance, and delivery and maintains the relationship between CSPs and cloud consumers.
Which of the following components in Docker architecture refers to locations where images are stored and pulled whenever required?

Irin, a cloud security architect, is a disgruntled ex-employee of an organization who has access to cloud resources and knows about the organization's cloud network. Using this information, she deliberately accesses the critical documents and compromises the sensitive information available in the cloud. Identify the cloud threat demonstrated in the above scenario.

James, a certified hacker, was hired to intrude into an organization's network to perform malicious activities. James targeted an employee's system and started sending fraudulent and defective firmware updates. Soon after the employee clicked on one of the updates received, the attacker achieved complete control over the victim's system and gained access to the organization's network. Identity the type of attack performed by James in the above scenario.

John, a professional penetration tester, was hired by an organization for conducting a penetration test on their IT infrastructure. He was assigned the task of identifying risks, rather than finding vulnerabilities. In this process, he defined the goal before initiating the penetration test and performed multiple parallel processes to achieve the goal. Identify the type of penetration testing approach followed by John in the above scenario.
Which of the following malware components protects malware from reverse engineering or analysis, thus making it difficult to detect by security mechanisms?
Which of the following encryption algorithms does WPK2 use?

Abel, a cloud architect, uses container technology to deploy applications/software including all its dependencies, such as libraries and configuration files, binaries, and other resources that run independently from other processes in the cloud environment. For the containerization of applications, he follows the five-tier container technology architecture. Currently, Abel is storing images and disseminating images to the orchestrators based on requests. Which of the following tiers of the container technology architecture is Abel currently working in?
options: B. Tier-2: Testing and accreditation systems

question: Which IoT architecture faces these security issues Insecure API, lack of communication channels encryption, authentication, lack of storage security?
Which of the following tools is used for Password Cracking?
What is the network segregation technique that is used to isolate networks and assets to impose and maintain strong access control mechanisms.
Which of the following is defined as storage on a different machine or disk after the original disk becomes full, is case-sensitive, and can be used to provide object-level security?

Daniel, a professional hacker, targeted Alice and lured her into downloading a malicious app from a third-party app store. Upon installation, the core malicious code inside the application started infecting other legitimate apps in Alice's mobile device. Daniel overloaded Alice's device with irrelevant and fraudulent advertisements through the infected app for financial gain. Identify the type of attack Daniel has launched in the above scenario.

Robert, a security specialist, was appointed to strengthen the security of the organization's network. To prevent multiple login attempts from unknown sources, Robert implemented a security strategy of issuing alerts or warning messages when multiple failed login attempts are made. Which of the following security risks is addressed by Robert to make attempted break-ins unsuccessful?
options: Absence of account lockout for invalid session IDs
answer: Absence of account lockout for invalid session IDs

question: Wesley, a fitness freak, purchased a new Apple smartwatch and synced it with a mobile app downloaded from an unauthorized third party. At the end of the day, when Wesley attempted to access his fitness report from the app, it generated an unusual report and asked for some unnecessary permissions to view it. Which of the following mobile risks is demonstrated in the above scenario?

Bruce, a professional hacker, targeted an OT network. He initiated a looping strategy to recover the password of the target system. He started sending one character at a time to check whether the first character entered is correct: If so, he continued the loop for consecutive characters. Using thistechnique. Bruce identified how much time the device takes to finish one complete password authentication process, through which he determined the correct characters in the target password. Identify the type of attack launched by Bruce on the target OT network.

Cibel.org, an organization, wanted to develop a web application for marketing its products to the public. In this process, they consulted a cloud service provider and requested provision of development tools, configuration management, and deployment platforms for developing customized applications. Identify the type of cloud service requested by Cibel.org in the above scenario.
Which of the following is defined as individuals who aim to bring down critical infrastructure for a “cause” and are unconcerned about facing jail terms or other punishment?
